ygData.subject: Not Following Her Example.

** Dinobot watched everything unfold before his newly repaired optics, 
seeing both the pain and confusion in Tavatrons optics as so many things 
happened all at once.
He could almost swear that he might have even seen anger in her expression 
besides hurt and confusion.
But his own expression never changed, not in the slightest.
Even as he eventually sat and watched Tavatron stand at attention right 
beside him, his mind dwelling far too much on the fact that she had 
abandoned him to care what she did.
But he growled at her words as he slowly slid down from the metal slab which 
had been his repair table for slag knew how long.
Dinobot�s voice nothing but a deadly calmed growl.**

� Well, see to it that it doesn�t.

** His legs almost felt like jelly as he placed them evenly under him, but 
having to hang onto the table a bit for support.
Dinobot�s systems had never been damaged as much as they had been and he 
guessed that it would take his systems a bit of time to get use to operating 
at full capacity once again, which was just fine with him�to a point. If 
this little factor stopped him from engaging in battle he would have to see 
to it that something like this never happened again.
But even as he made sure that he could stand on his own, Dinobot�s mind 
could never get over the fact that Tavatron had abandoned him like that.
After all he had done for her, after all the times he had been there for 
her�now she pulled this on him?
Indeed, even now he was having second thoughts about attacking Tavatrons 
honor as he did, but he still felt a slight�bitterness towards her, which he 
had to admit he had not felt in quite some time.
But even the thought of this bitterness reminded him of the last time he had 
felt it�which was when he was young and still living with his mother. After 
she had had his younger half brother, he remembered the little brats fourth 
birthday. Both his biological father and Dinobot/s mother had given him 
something; he couldn�t remember what, but it was something that Dinobot had 
always wanted but had never gotten.
But when his birthday had rolled around he had gotten nothing, not even a 
great greeting from a single soul in the compound, but then his younger 
brother�s day came that spoiled brat got whatever his little spark desired.

Dinobot growled deeply within his metallic throat. And that bitterness he 
felt towards his mother in particular was what he felt now, only worse 
because he knew just what it meant now.
His mother had forgotten he had even existed, and even now he was afraid 
that would happen again. But since he never showed fear it was transformed 
into a feeling he COULD express, bitterness.
But even back then he had asked why that had happened, with no answer from a 
soul�not even his own.
And now he had been abandoned again? Or had he even been truly accepted in 
the first place?
Though, even as Dinobot thought that he knew that Tavatron had really 
accepted him, for whom he was as well.
A growl flowed from his throat, and now�now had he ruined it, ruined it all?
Most likely.

Dinobot glanced over at Tavatron.
Had she ever had anything like his past ever happen to her? Did she knew 
just what the pain of abandonment could feel like? The gut ripping feeling, 
which was only fear, transformed into something a bot could handle? If so 
then she knew how he felt right now.
But if she knew, she showed no signs of it.
However, perhaps the reason he had assaulted her honor as a warrior as he 
did was to make her feel that, make her feel as if she was never wanted and 
never mattered. But if that was it, then it had worked.
Though, even though he knew that his words was something in which was wise 
to reverse, he knew it was too late to say anything as he watched Tavatron 
transform into beast mode. And the ice rimmed glare that she turned upon him 
before exiting almost shook that steel and unemotional look he wore into 
something more of shock. But he kept his stance and expression�the best he 
could.

Dinobot didn�t follow or chase after Tavatron as she trotted out of the CR 
room, simply crossing his arms and leaning back against the table. His 
optics hidden once again under his brow, giving him the look which would 
make a Predacon think twice of bothering him now. But he knew that Tavatron 
was upset, and even though her steps were steady until she was out of sight, 
he heard them quicken to a jog and them a run until he could no longer hear 
them padding against the hall floors.
So, now he was left along and in silence, not moving, but he mind spinning 
at 100 mph.
But it didn�t matter what he thought about or what he had in mind as right, 
it always turned out to be the factor that he had gone way too far this 
time, but Tavatron was equally at fault.
And why did females have to be so�so�emotional?
It just so happened that there was nothing he could do to change something 
like that, but he always managed to forget that others really did have 
feelings, even though he never seemed to, and their feelings could get hurt.
Which was what happened less then 20 cycles ago.
And that was what now played on his mind, the fact that he had done 
something like this to Tavatron�even though she deserved it slightly. Just 
because she had�abandoned him�there was no reason to follow her example now.

With that Dinobot stood up straight, looking out from under his brow at the 
closed CR doors.
No reason to follow her example at all�.

( 30 min later)


Her howl echoed over the forest which the cliff expanded over, never hearing 
something so plaintive and painful in his entire life.
Dinobot looked at Tavatron through the leaves of near trees he passed, not 
even knowing that in face he had followed her as quietly as possible in 
beast mode.
He shook a bit as he walked closer, pain emanating from his lungs since his 
systems were still not use to operating at such high levels yet. But it had 
been very painful just trying to keep up with this femwolf at a distance, 
even keeping with her pace. But now, thank the Matrix, she had stopped and 
sat still while he caught up, swearing quietly as a stitch began to develop 
in his side. Sweat trickling from the end of his transmetal jaws, both from 
his overheating body�and trying to keep the pain down.
Dinobot growled and placed a clawed for limb over the growing stitch as he 
moved on, seeing Tavatron finally stop her howling through the trees.
Back in the CR room had had finally decided to follow her, even if it meant 
apologizing to the fembot who abandoned him. He was worried that something 
might happen to her but he also didn�t want to follow her example.
Even though she might have left him when he need her, he wasn�t about to 
leave her if she needed him.

As Tavatrons howl died out Dinobot growled, finally and silently pushing 
through the last bit of bush before he stepped out a few feet right behind 
Tavatron, grinding his teeth as the stitch flared up again.
Watching her lay her head down on her paws he simply stood there, knowing 
for a fact that she would know that he was there sooner or later.
But he wasn�t there just because he was worried about her, but also because 
he still wanted to know just why she had left and maybe let her speak her 
mind while he could as well.
This had to be settled and soon, there was no way he was going to let her 
slip away this time.
This was going to be settled, even if he had to get down on his knees and 
bet her forgiveness first. Even though he hoped to the Matrix above that he 
didn�t have to.
It took him just enough will power and courage to swamp an army just to get 
up the nerve to follow her, in threat that he had to apologize.  But his 
voice was a growl, even though there was more pain behind it then 
annoyance.**

� I swear, you have me�wrapped around your little�finger�.�

** Still holding the stitch in his side.**
